I am a biostatistics PhD candidate at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. I work with Cristian Tomasetti in the field of cancer genomics to develop statistical methods for the early detection of cancer and to model carcinogenesis. I also work with Stephanie Hicks to analyze single nucleus RNA sequencing data. Previously, I received my bachelorâ€™s in math and statistics from the University of Chicago.

In my free time, I enjoy blogging about statistics, computing, and PhD life, and playing music in the Hopkins Orchestra and the Hopkins Bloombachs.
